conclusion: Need to analyze the v-t graph to determine if the particle has gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
The x-axis represents time in seconds and the y-axis represents velocity in m/s.
The graph shows the velocity of the particle at different times.
The segment of interest is from 1 to 2 seconds.
At t = 1 second, the velocity is 20 m/s.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s.
The velocity decreases from 20 m/s to 10 m/s over 1 second.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
Calculate acceleration: a = (10 m/s - 20 m/s) / (2 s - 1 s) = -10 m/s².
The negative sign indicates deceleration, and the magnitude is constant at 10 m/s².
The particle is undergoing linear motion with constant acceleration, not gradually decreasing.
Final answer: No, the particle does not have gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
